headline: Why Businesses Are Considered High-Risk
description: Understanding the factors that make a business high-risk for payment processing
articleBody: Merchants are often considered high-risk due to factors like chargeback rates, industry type, regulatory scrutiny, ticket size, business history, and processing volume. Zenti helps you understand these factors and find the right solution for your specific needs.

headline: High-Risk Processing Fees Explained
description: Understanding how processing fees work for high-risk businesses
articleBody: High-risk processing fees are typically higher than mainstream businesses due to increased risk. Pricing is structured with percentage rates, per-transaction fees, monthly fees, and sometimes rolling reserves. Zenti offers best-price guarantees for high-risk businesses.

headline: Rolling Reserves Explained
description: Understanding what rolling reserves are and how they work
articleBody: A rolling reserve is a percentage of your processing volume held by the processor as security against chargebacks and refunds. It's typically 5-10% held for 6-12 months. Zenti helps you understand reserve requirements and negotiate favorable terms.

headline: Account Termination and TMF/MATCH Lists
description: What to do if your payment processing account is terminated
articleBody: If your account is terminated, you may be placed on TMF/MATCH lists. Zenti helps you understand removal processes and provides alternative solutions to keep your business running during transitions. Some processors will consider those who have been on the MATCH list, but it depends on the specific MATCH code.
